DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS 43 Adult Profile v2.0 PAININ31 Past 7 Days How Much Did Pain Interfere with Ability to Participate in Social Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much in the past 7 days pain interfered with their ability to participate in social activities, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS-43 Adult Profile v2.0 Past Week How Much Did Pain Interfere with Ability to Participate in Social Activities Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles._The most recent week, including today._A question about how much a person's pain interferes or interfered with their ability to participate in social activities._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles.

Concepts.definition: A 43-item multidimensional and universal measure of health intended for use across a variety of conditions. It measures an adult patient's self-reported health status in seven domains: physical function, anxiety, depression, fatigue, sleep disturbance, pain interference, and participation in social roles.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: How Much Did Pain Interfere with Ability to Participate in Social Activities
Concepts.definition: A question about how much a person's pain interferes or interfered with their ability to participate in social activities.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Pain Interference 5 Point  Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the PROMIS pain interference scale for rating a patient's pain during the last seven days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Value corrections 1/12/15 Changed attributes to meet PRO/HRQOL requirements for CRF R6 data standards. mc

ReferenceDocuments.name: How much did pain interfere w
ReferenceDocuments.description: How much did pain interfere with your ability to participate in social activities?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for ECOG-ACRIN study in Rave per request by S. Roulliard. mc 5/5/15
